CatDescriptText: Avelia Brown, postal worker, Homewood was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 26, 1960, pg. 29 with question: "Do you think a Negro will be named to fill the police inspectorship vacancy created by the resignation of Inspector Albert Jones?" Answer reads: "It is hard to say.  However, there definitely should be one, because every day colored people are getting greater breaks, better openings..."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Avelia Brown wearing patterned blouse and light colored coat, standing in front of building with sign that reads "Art Institute of Pittsburgh" and store window with menu and flower pot
